channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Your Chocolate Fix Is About to Get More Expensive
item.description: Cocoa prices are going nuts, after a crop failure in West Africa was followed by a rush of investor speculation.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: White House Aide Warns Israel Against ‘Smashing Into Rafah’
item.description: President Biden has grown more wary of a major assault in the city in southern Gaza.

item.title: Shark Tank entrepreneur: E-commerce giants are eating my sister's lunch—and destroying the American Dream
item.description: Although e-commerce platforms say they do their best to counter knockoffs, our experience proves the opposite.

item.title: Police Arrest M.I.T. Protesters After Suspensions Ramp Up Tension
item.description: Officers entered an encampment at the university early Friday after a 15-minute warning. About a dozen people were arrested.

item.title: How Pro-Palestinian Students Pushed Trinity College Dublin to Divest
item.description: A surge of attention hit Ireland’s most prestigious university over protests that involved Israel, Gaza and the famed medieval Book of Kells.

item.title: Apple forced into rare apology for 'tone-deaf' iPad advert
item.description: Apple’s Tor Myhren said the Big Tech giant had "missed the mark" with the video released this week, and apologized to customers who called out the brand for its "tone-deaf" marketing.

item.title: The Debate Over Rafah
item.description: A look at the conflicting views of President Biden and Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: Kherson Residents Rebuild and Brace for New Russian Attack
item.description: The people of the Kherson region have slowly rebuilt their homes and livelihoods since a Ukrainian counteroffensive forced out Russian troops. Now they are bracing for another Russian attack.

item.title: Baidu exec who started furor over 24/7 work culture with videos making light of staff wellbeing and warning subordinates to toe the line has resigned
item.description: “I’m not your mother-in-law,” she said in one of the clips she posted to Douyin, China’s version of TikTok.

item.title: The Latest in Rafah, and a Key Trump Trial Witness Returns to the Stand
After Her Sister Wed at 11, a Girl Began Fighting Child Marriage at 13
item.description: Memory Banda’s battle, which she has been waging since she was a teenager in a village in Malawi, started with a poignant question: “Why should this be happening to girls so young?”

item.title: SoftBank has sold off or written down $29 billion in U.S. Vision Fund assets as Masayoshi Son tries to get his mojo back by turning to AI and chips
item.description: One project reportedly being considered by Softbank's CEO: a $100 billion chip venture to compete with Nvidia.

item.title: Stormy Daniels Takes the Stand
item.description: The porn star testified for eight hours at Donald Trump’s hush-money trial. This is how it went.

item.title: UNRWA Says It Closed East Jerusalem Headquarters After Fire and Attacks
item.description: The leader of the agency said Israeli residents had set the fire, which caused extensive damage, but that no staff had been injured.

item.title: Biden administration expected to impose sweeping tariffs on China strategic sectors
item.description: The decision is the culmination of a review of so-called Section 301 tariffs first put into place under Trump starting in 2018.
